meanings.definition: A person employed to prevent troublemakers from entering a bar or nightclub.
meanings.sent1: The bouncers at the club ensure everyone has a good time.
meanings.sent2: The bouncers checked IDs at the entrance to the bar.
meanings.sent3: The bouncers joked with the regulars while keeping an eye out for any trouble.
meanings.sent4: The bouncers were like gatekeepers, only allowing in those who followed the rules.
meanings.sent5: The bouncers were like protectors, shielding the patrons from any harm.

meanings.definition: A device used to absorb the shock of a bouncing object.
meanings.sent1: The bouncers on the trampoline help reduce the impact on your body.
meanings.sent2: The rubber bouncers on the bottom of the chair soften the landing.
meanings.sent3: The bouncers on the doorstop keep the door from slamming shut.
meanings.sent4: The car's bouncers absorbed the vibrations from the rough road.
meanings.sent5: The mattress had bouncers that made it more comfortable to sleep on.

meanings.definition: A person who bounces, as in dancing or jumping.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was a natural bouncer on the trampoline.
meanings.sent2: The energetic bouncer leaped across the stage during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The bouncer bounced around the dance floor with infectious energy.
meanings.sent4: The kangaroo was the ultimate bouncer in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The bouncer's moves were so smooth, it looked like they were floating in the air.
